1 /****************************************************
2 AMS 5600 class for the Raspberry Pi
3 
4 Author: Robert Mitchell (adapted from Tom Denton)
5 
6 Date: 23rd November 2020
7 
8 File: AMS_5600_PI.cpp
9 
10 Version 1.00
11 
12 Description: This class is designed to interface
13 with the AS5600 magnetic encoder via I2C on a Raspberry
14 Pi. The original version (written for Arduino) can be
15 found at:
16 https://github.com/Seeed-Studio/Seeed_Arduino_AS5600
17 /***************************************************/

19 // I2C includes
20 extern "C" {
21 #include <linux/i2c-dev.h>
22 //#include <i2c/smbus.h>
23 #include <linux/ioctl.h>
24 #include <fcntl.h> // open() and O_RDWR
25 #include <unistd.h> // close()
26 }

36 /****************************************************
37 /* Method: AMS_5600
38 /* In: none
39 /* Out: none
40 /* Description: constructor class for AMS 5600
41 /***************************************************/
42 AMS_5600::AMS_5600()
43 {
44  /* set i2c address */
45  _ams5600_Address = 0x36;
46 
47  /* load register values*/
48  /* c++ class forbids pre loading of variables */
49  _zmco = 0x00;
50  _zpos_hi = 0x01;
51  _zpos_lo = 0x02;
52  _mpos_hi = 0x03;
53  _mpos_lo = 0x04;
54  _mang_hi = 0x05;
55  _mang_lo = 0x06;
56  _conf_hi = 0x07;
57  _conf_lo = 0x08;
58  _raw_ang_hi = 0x0c;
59  _raw_ang_lo = 0x0d;
60  _ang_hi = 0x0e;
61  _ang_lo = 0x0f;
62  _stat = 0x0b;
63  _agc = 0x1a;
64  _mag_hi = 0x1b;
65  _mag_lo = 0x1c;
66  _burn = 0xff;
67 }
68 
69 AMS_5600::AMS_5600(uint8_t channel){
70  _channel = channel; // Only additional step, useful for the mux
71 
72  /* set i2c address */
73  _ams5600_Address = 0x36;
74 
75  /* load register values*/
76  /* c++ class forbids pre loading of variables */
77  _zmco = 0x00;
78  _zpos_hi = 0x01;
79  _zpos_lo = 0x02;
80  _mpos_hi = 0x03;
81  _mpos_lo = 0x04;
82  _mang_hi = 0x05;
83  _mang_lo = 0x06;
84  _conf_hi = 0x07;
85  _conf_lo = 0x08;
86  _raw_ang_hi = 0x0c;
87  _raw_ang_lo = 0x0d;
88  _ang_hi = 0x0e;
89  _ang_lo = 0x0f;
90  _stat = 0x0b;
91  _agc = 0x1a;
92  _mag_hi = 0x1b;
93  _mag_lo = 0x1c;
94  _burn = 0xff;
95 }

97 std::string AMS_5600::testInteraction(){ return "Test"; }

99 // Useful for the mux
100 const uint8_t AMS_5600::getChannel(){ return _channel; }
101 
102 // I2C initialisation: https://www.kernel.org/doc/Documentation/i2c/dev-interface
103 void AMS_5600::init(std::string bus){
104  _i2c_fd = 0;
105 
106  if ((_i2c_fd = open(bus.c_str(), O_RDWR)) < 0) std::exit(1);
107 
108  if (ioctl(_i2c_fd, I2C_SLAVE, _ams5600_Address) < 0){
109  close(_i2c_fd);
110  std::exit(1);
111  }
112 }
113 
114 /* mode = 0, output PWM, mode = 1 output analog (full range from 0% to 100% between GND and VDD*/
115 void AMS_5600::setOutPut(uint8_t mode){
116  uint8_t config_status;
117 
118  config_status = readOneByte(_conf_lo);
119 
120  if (mode == 1) {
121  config_status = config_status & 0xcf;
122  } else {
123  config_status = config_status & 0xef;
124  }
125 
126  writeOneByte(_conf_lo, lowByte(config_status));
127 }
128 
129 /****************************************************
130 /* Method: AMS_5600
131 /* In: none
132 /* Out: i2c address of AMS 5600
133 /* Description: returns i2c address of AMS 5600
134 /***************************************************/
135 int AMS_5600::getAddress(){
136  return _ams5600_Address;
137 }
138 
139 /*******************************************************
140 /* Method: setMaxAngle
141 /* In: new maximum angle to set OR none
142 /* Out: value of max angle register
143 /* Description: sets a value in maximum angle register.
144 /* If no value is provided, method will read position of
145 /* magnet. Setting this register zeros out max position
146 /* register.
147 /*******************************************************/
148 word AMS_5600::setMaxAngle(word newMaxAngle){
149  word retVal;
150  if(newMaxAngle == -1)
151  {
152  _maxAngle = getRawAngle();
153  }
154  else
155  _maxAngle = newMaxAngle;
156 
157  writeOneByte(_mang_hi, highByte(_maxAngle));
158  std::this_thread::sleep_for(std::chrono::milliseconds(2));
159  writeOneByte(_mang_lo, lowByte(_maxAngle));
160  std::this_thread::sleep_for(std::chrono::milliseconds(2));
161 
162  retVal = readTwoBytes(_mang_hi, _mang_lo);
163  return retVal;
164 }
165 
166 
167 /*******************************************************
168 /* Method: getMaxAngle
169 /* In: none
170 /* Out: value of max angle register
171 /* Description: gets value of maximum angle register.
172 /*******************************************************/
173 word AMS_5600::getMaxAngle()
174 {
175  return readTwoBytes(_mang_hi, _mang_lo);
176 }
177 
178 /*******************************************************
179 /* Method: setStartPosition
180 /* In: new start angle position
181 /* Out: value of start position register
182 /* Description: sets a value in start position register.
183 /* If no value is provided, method will read position of
184 /* magnet.
185 /*******************************************************/
186 word AMS_5600::setStartPosition(word startAngle)
187 {
188  if(startAngle == -1)
189  {
190  _rawStartAngle = getRawAngle();
191  }
192  else
193  _rawStartAngle = startAngle;
194 
195  writeOneByte(_zpos_hi, highByte(_rawStartAngle));
196  std::this_thread::sleep_for(std::chrono::milliseconds(2));
197  writeOneByte(_zpos_lo, lowByte(_rawStartAngle));
198  std::this_thread::sleep_for(std::chrono::milliseconds(2));
199  _zPosition = readTwoBytes(_zpos_hi, _zpos_lo);
200 
201  return(_zPosition);
202 }
203 
204 /*******************************************************
205 /* Method: getStartPosition
206 /* In: none
207 /* Out: value of start position register
208 /* Description: gets value of start position register.
209 /*******************************************************/
210 word AMS_5600::getStartPosition()
211 {
212  return readTwoBytes(_zpos_hi, _zpos_lo);
213 }
214 
215 /*******************************************************
216 /* Method: setEndtPosition
217 /* In: new end angle position
218 /* Out: value of end position register
219 /* Description: sets a value in end position register.
220 /* If no value is provided, method will read position of
221 /* magnet.
222 /*******************************************************/
223 word AMS_5600::setEndPosition(word endAngle)
224 {
225  if(endAngle == -1)
226  _rawEndAngle = getRawAngle();
227  else
228  _rawEndAngle = endAngle;
229 
230  writeOneByte(_mpos_hi, highByte(_rawEndAngle));
231  std::this_thread::sleep_for(std::chrono::milliseconds(2));
232  writeOneByte(_mpos_lo, lowByte(_rawEndAngle));
233  std::this_thread::sleep_for(std::chrono::milliseconds(2));
234  _mPosition = readTwoBytes(_mpos_hi, _mpos_lo);
235 
236  return(_mPosition);
237 }
238 
239 /*******************************************************
240 /* Method: getEndPosition
241 /* In: none
242 /* Out: value of end position register
243 /* Description: gets value of end position register.
244 /*******************************************************/
245 word AMS_5600::getEndPosition()
246 {
247  word retVal = readTwoBytes(_mpos_hi, _mpos_lo);
248  return retVal;
249 }
250 
251 /*******************************************************
252 /* Method: getRawAngle
253 /* In: none
254 /* Out: value of raw angle register
255 /* Description: gets raw value of magnet position.
256 /* start, end, and max angle settings do not apply
257 /*******************************************************/
258 word AMS_5600::getRawAngle()
259 {
260  return readTwoBytes(_raw_ang_hi, _raw_ang_lo);
261 }
262 
263 /* Method: getSpeed()
264  In: none
265  Out: A speed measurement taken over 0.5 seconds
266  Description: Conducts two angle measurements taken milliseconds apart
267  then uses the absolute difference between the two
268  measurements to give the speed in degrees/second.
269  */
270 double AMS_5600::getSpeed()
271 {
272  double first_measurement, second_measurement;
273  first_measurement = this->getRawAngle()*0.087;
274  std::this_thread::sleep_for(std::chrono::milliseconds(10));
275  second_measurement = this->getRawAngle()*0.087;
276 
277  return std::fabs(second_measurement - first_measurement) * 10;
278 }
279 
280 
281 /*******************************************************
282 /* Method: getScaledAngle
283 /* In: none
284 /* Out: value of scaled angle register
285 /* Description: gets scaled value of magnet position.
286 /* start, end, or max angle settings are used to
287 /* determine value
288 /*******************************************************/
289 word AMS_5600::getScaledAngle()
290 {
291  return readTwoBytes(_ang_hi, _ang_lo);
292 }
293 
294 /*******************************************************
295 /* Method: detectMagnet
296 /* In: none
297 /* Out: 1 if magnet is detected, 0 if not
298 /* Description: reads status register and examines the
299 /* MH bit
300 /*******************************************************/
301 int AMS_5600::detectMagnet()
302 {
303  int magStatus;
304  int retVal = 0;
305  /*0 0 MD ML MH 0 0 0*/
306  /* MD high = AGC minimum overflow, Magnet to strong */
307  /* ML high = AGC Maximum overflow, magnet to weak*/
308  /* MH high = magnet detected*/
309  magStatus = readOneByte(_stat);
310 
311  if(magStatus & 0x20)
312  retVal = 1;
313 
314  return retVal;
315 }
316 
317 /*******************************************************
318 /* Method: getMagnetStrength
319 /* In: none
320 /* Out: 0 if no magnet is detected
321 /* 1 if magnet is to weak
322 /* 2 if magnet is just right
323 /* 3 if magnet is to strong
324 /* Description: reads status register andexamins the MH,ML,MD bits
325 /*******************************************************/
326 int AMS_5600::getMagnetStrength()
327 {
328  int magStatus;
329  int retVal = 0;
330  /*0 0 MD ML MH 0 0 0*/
331  /* MD high = AGC minimum overflow, Magnet too strong */
332  /* ML high = AGC Maximum overflow, magnet too weak*/
333  /* MH high = magnet detected*/
334  magStatus = readOneByte(_stat);
335  if(detectMagnet() ==1)
336  {
337  retVal = 2; /*just right */
338  if(magStatus & 0x10)
339  retVal = 1; /*too weak */
340  else if(magStatus & 0x08)
341  retVal = 3; /*too strong */
342  }
343 
344  return retVal;
345 }
346 
347 /*******************************************************
348 /* Method: get Agc
349 /* In: none
350 /* Out: value of AGC register
351 /* Description: gets value of AGC register.
352 /*******************************************************/
353 int AMS_5600::getAgc()
354 {
355  return readOneByte(_agc);
356 }
357 
358 /*******************************************************
359 /* Method: getMagnitude
360 /* In: none
361 /* Out: value of magnitude register
362 /* Description: gets value of magnitude register.
363 /*******************************************************/
364 word AMS_5600::getMagnitude()
365 {
366  return readTwoBytes(_mag_hi, _mag_lo);
367 }
368 
369 /*******************************************************
370 /* Method: getBurnCount
371 /* In: none
372 /* Out: value of zmco register
373 /* Description: determines how many times chip has been
374 /* permanently written to.
375 /*******************************************************/
376 int AMS_5600::getBurnCount()
377 {
378  return readOneByte(_zmco);
379 }
380 
381 /*******************************************************
382 /* Method: burnAngle
383 /* In: none
384 /* Out: 1 success
385 /* -1 no magnet
386 /* -2 burn limit exceeded
387 /* -3 start and end positions not set (useless burn)
388 /* Description: burns start and end positions to chip.
389 /* THIS CAN ONLY BE DONE 3 TIMES
390 /*******************************************************/
391 int AMS_5600::burnAngle()
392 {
393  int retVal = 1;
394  _zPosition = getStartPosition();
395  _mPosition = getEndPosition();
396  _maxAngle = getMaxAngle();
397 
398  if(detectMagnet() == 1)
399  {
400  if(getBurnCount() < 3)
401  {
402  if((_zPosition == 0)&&(_mPosition ==0))
403  retVal = -3;
404  else
405  writeOneByte(_burn, 0x80);
406  }
407  else
408  retVal = -2;
409  }
410  else
411  retVal = -1;
412 
413  return retVal;
414 }
415 
416 /*******************************************************
417 /* Method: burnMaxAngleAndConfig
418 /* In: none
419 /* Out: 1 success
420 /* -1 burn limit exceeded
421 /* -2 max angle is to small, must be at or above 18 degrees
422 /* Description: burns max angle and config data to chip.
423 /* THIS CAN ONLY BE DONE 1 TIME
424 /*******************************************************/
425 int AMS_5600::burnMaxAngleAndConfig()
426 {
427  int retVal = 1;
428  _maxAngle = getMaxAngle();
429 
430  if(getBurnCount() ==0)
431  {
432  if(_maxAngle*0.087 < 18) {
433  retVal = -2;
434  } else {
435  writeOneByte(_burn, 0x40);
436  }
437  } else {
438  retVal = -1;
439  }
440 
441  return retVal;
442 }
443 
444 
445 /*******************************************************
446 /* Method: readOneByte
447 /* In: register to read
448 /* Out: data read from i2c
449 /* Description: reads one byte register from i2c
450 /*******************************************************/
451 int AMS_5600::readOneByte(int in_adr){
452  int retVal = -1;
453 
454  /* Arduino - Manual I2C read procedure:
455  Wire.beginTransmission(_ams5600_Address); // i2c_start with device address
456  Wire.write(in_adr); // write register address that we want to read from
457  Wire.endTransmission(); // i2c_stop
458  Wire.requestFrom(_ams5600_Address, 1); // Read a byte from the address
459  */
460 
461  // Relies on in_adr being a sensible value (i.e. uint8_t).
462  retVal = i2c_smbus_read_byte_data(_i2c_fd, in_adr);
463 
464  return retVal;
465 }
466 
467 /*******************************************************
468 /* Method: readOneByte
469 /* In: two registers to read
470 /* Out: data read from i2c as a word
471 /* Description: reads two bytes register from i2c
472 /*******************************************************/
473 word AMS_5600::readTwoBytes(int in_adr_hi, int in_adr_lo)
474 {
475  word retVal = -1;
476 
477  /* Read Low Byte */
478  int low = i2c_smbus_read_byte_data(_i2c_fd, in_adr_lo);
479 
480  /* Read High Byte */
481  int high = i2c_smbus_read_byte_data(_i2c_fd, in_adr_hi);
482 
483  // Combine high and low into single 2-byte value
484  high = high << 8;
485  retVal = high | low;
486 
487  return retVal;
488 }
489 
490 /*******************************************************
491 /* Method: writeOneByte
492 /* In: address and data to write
493 /* Out: none
494 /* Description: writes one byte to a i2c register
495 /*******************************************************/
496 void AMS_5600::writeOneByte(int adr_in, int dat_in)
497 {
498  i2c_smbus_write_byte_data(_i2c_fd, adr_in, dat_in);
499 }
500 
501 // Helper methods which are normally defined by Arduino.h
502 inline uint8_t AMS_5600::lowByte(int w) {
503  return ((uint8_t) w & 0xff);
504 }
505 
506 inline uint8_t AMS_5600::highByte(int w) {
507  return ((uint8_t) w >> 8);
508 }
